replit.md.content:
# SOMVI Somalia - Construction Supply Chain Platform

## Overview

SOMVI Somalia is a web-based platform designed to streamline the construction supply chain by connecting contractors with verified suppliers and logistics providers in Somalia and potentially Kenya. It enables users to request quotes (RFQs), compare supplier prices, and manage material orders through a unified interface. The platform features both a client-facing catalog for material ordering and an administrative dashboard for comprehensive management of RFQs, suppliers, clients, and financial tracking, including profit and markup management, plus a complete CRM system with a Trello-style Kanban board for sales pipeline management. The goal is to replicate the efficiency and user experience of platforms like BRKZ.com, focusing on an English-only interface and international units for broader appeal.

## User Preferences

Preferred communication style: Simple, everyday language.

## System Architecture

### Frontend Architecture

**Technology Stack:** React 18, TypeScript, Vite, Radix UI, shadcn/ui, Tailwind CSS (HSL color system), React Router, React Context API, React Hook Form, Zod.
**Design System:** Responsive design (mobile-first), Inter font, brand colors (Blue-Gray, Orange), custom animations.
**Client Platform:** BRKZ.com-style layout with an English-only interface, 12 main product categories and 50+ subcategories, compact sidebar, 4-column product grid, clean card design with 44px images, and a BRKZ.com-style quantity selector dialog. Clients register using WhatsApp numbers (+252/+254 validation), prices are hidden, and RFQ submission is a two-step process.
**Admin Dashboard:** Features include RFQ Management, Sales Pipeline (CRM with Kanban board), Supplier Management, Client Management, Material Management (with supplier assignments), Finance Tracking (delivery fees, taxes, profit), Reports, and Completed Orders. It includes 5 real-time statistics cards (Total Clients, RFQs, Pending Quotes, Completed Orders, Total Profit) and a monthly RFQs chart.
**Component Architecture:** Reusable UI components, feature-specific components, page components, and marketing components.

### Data Management

**Database:** PostgreSQL (Neon-backed) with Drizzle ORM for type-safe operations.
**Data Models:**
- **Clients:** Stores unique client WhatsApp numbers, names, and company details.
- **RFQs:** Manages RFQ details including project name, items, status, total amount, profit, and markup.
- **RFQ Items:** Normalized line items for RFQs with material details and supplier pricing.
- **Leads:** Comprehensive CRM data including contractor details, project info, pipeline stage, lead source (from_rfq or manual), materials needed, estimated value, and tracking notes. Supports 6 pipeline stages: new_request, rfq_sent, quotes_received, contractor_review, in_delivery, completed.
- **Materials:** Bilingual catalog (English and Somali fields) but client platform uses English fields, with category, subcategory, and image URLs.
- **Suppliers:** Stores supplier information including contact details, category, and status.
- **Material Suppliers Junction:** Links materials to up to 5 suppliers with price and markup.
- **Settings:** Stores default markup, currency, tax rate, and delivery base rate.
**State Flow:** Client-side shopping cart uses React Context; form submissions persist to PostgreSQL via API; RFQ status workflow (pending → quoted → completed); Leads pipeline workflow (new_request → rfq_sent → quotes_received → contractor_review → in_delivery → completed); React Query for data fetching and caching.

### Authentication & Authorization

**JWT-based Authentication:**
- Secure login at `/login` with email and password fields
- JWT tokens stored in httpOnly cookies (7-day expiration)
- Password hashing using bcryptjs (10 rounds)
- Cookie-based sessions with secure, sameSite strict settings
- Automatic token verification middleware on protected routes

**Default Admin Account:**
- Email: admin@somvi.so
- Password: somvi123
- Role: admin
- Automatically seeded on server startup

**Role-Based Access Control (RBAC):**
- **Admin**: Full access to all features including Users, Settings, Finance, and Markup management
- **Assistant**: RFQs edit only (RFQ Management, Add RFQ pages)
- **Sales**: CRM + leads management (Clients page access)
- **Procurement**: Supplier prices management (Suppliers and Materials pages)
- **Logistics**: Delivery updates (Completed Orders access)

**Protected Routes:**
- All `/admin/*` routes require authentication
- Role-specific access enforced on sensitive pages
- Automatic redirect to `/login` for unauthenticated users
- Access denied message for insufficient permissions

**Users Management:**
- Admin-only page at `/admin/users`
- CRUD operations for user accounts
- Role assignment with validation
- Duplicate email prevention
- Secure password updates (hashed before storage)
- Field-level validation (only allowed fields can be updated)

**Security Features:**
- Schema validation on all user mutations
- Whitelisted allowed roles (prevents privilege escalation)
- Duplicate email checking on create/update
- Allowed fields filter on updates (name, email, password, role only)
- Password hashing for all password operations
- Protection against account clobbering

**Client Registration:**
- Client RFQ lookup and registration remain WhatsApp-based (no login required for clients)

### PDF Generation

Uses jsPDF with jspdf-autotable to generate SOMVI-branded RFQ quotation PDFs, including supplier pricing breakdowns, VAT calculations, and professional layouts.

### File Handling

Supports client attachment of files (PDF, Excel, Word) to RFQs (up to 10MB) for validation purposes; files are not persisted on the server.

### Responsive Design

Mobile-first approach using Tailwind CSS breakpoints and a custom mobile detection hook.

### Admin Features

- **Sales Pipeline (CRM)**: Trello-style Kanban board with drag-and-drop functionality for managing leads through 6 stages. Auto-creates leads from RFQ submissions with full data enrichment (contractor name, WhatsApp, project name, materials, estimated value). Supports manual lead creation by admin and sales roles. Features color-coded columns, lead cards with metadata display, and stage transition tracking.
- **Settings Page**: Manages company information, WhatsApp settings, and logo upload.
- **Markup Management**: Supports dual-formula pricing (flat amount or percentage commission) with live calculation examples and database support for `markupType`.

## External Dependencies

### UI Component Libraries
- **Radix UI**: Accessible component primitives.
- **shadcn/ui**: Pre-built components based on Radix UI.
- **Lucide React**: Icon library.

### Data Fetching & State
- **TanStack Query (React Query)**: Async state management.
- **React Hook Form**: Form handling.
- **Zod**: Schema validation.

### Styling & Utilities
- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first CSS.
- **class-variance-authority, clsx, tailwind-merge**: CSS class utilities.
- **cmdk**: Command palette component.

### Carousel & Interactions
- **Embla Carousel**: Carousel component.
- **Vaul**: Drawer component.
- **next-themes**: Theme management.

### PDF & Document Generation
- **jsPDF**: PDF generation.
- **jspdf-autotable**: Table plugin for jsPDF.

### Date Handling
- **date-fns**: Date utility library.

### Development Tools
- **TypeScript**: Type safety.
- **ESLint**: Code linting.
- **PostCSS**: CSS processing.
- **Vite**: Build tool and dev server.

### Third-Party Integrations
- **WhatsApp Business**: Primary communication channel for quotes and client registration (hardcoded link for Somalia).
- **Google Fonts**: Inter font.

### Asset Management
- Images stored in `src/assets/` or referenced via external URLs (e.g., Unsplash).

## Recent Changes

### Latest Updates (October 31, 2025)
- **Multi-Supplier Quotation System (COMPLETED):**
  - Redesigned QuoteCreationDialog UI to support up to 5 suppliers per material
  - Each material displays in its own card with dropdown to select number of suppliers to show (1-5)
  - Dynamic supplier rows: "Supplier 1", "Supplier 2", etc. with supplier selection + price input + auto-calculated totals
  - Backend updated to store nested supplier data structure (supplier1-5 with supplierId, unitPrice, totalPrice)
  - PDF generation dynamically builds table with multiple supplier columns based on suppliersToShow setting
  - **Supplier Confidentiality**: PDF always shows "Supplier 1, 2, 3..." instead of actual supplier names
  - Fixed critical bug in PDF totals calculation to use nested `supplier1.totalPrice` instead of flat structure
  - Validation ensures at least Supplier 1 has data before quote submission

- **WhatsApp PDF Sharing (COMPLETED):**
  - "Send WhatsApp" button downloads the PDF and opens WhatsApp with pre-filled message
  - User manually attaches the downloaded PDF to the WhatsApp conversation
  - Message format: "Hello [Client], Your quotation for [Project] is ready! RFQ Number: [#] Total: $[Amount] ✅ The quotation PDF has been downloaded. Please attach it to this conversation. Thank you for choosing SOMVI Somalia!"
  - Includes 500ms delay to ensure PDF downloads before WhatsApp opens

- **Sales Pipeline Enhancements (COMPLETED):**
  - Pipeline now displays ALL stages including "Completed" leads
  - Shows all leads (RFQ-based and manually created)
  - Sales personnel can move leads through stages independently without affecting RFQ status
  - One-way sync: RFQ status updates propagate to leads, but lead stage changes don't affect RFQ status
  - This allows sales and procurement teams to work independently

- **Material Selection Improvements (COMPLETED):**
  - Added category and subcategory dropdown filters to "Add RFQ" page
  - Added category and subcategory dropdown filters to "Add Materials to RFQ" dialog in RFQ Management
  - Dynamic subcategory population based on selected category
  - Smart filtering: category + subcategory + search work together
  - Material dropdown shows: Material Name - Subcategory (Unit) for better clarity
  - Reset behavior: changing category resets subcategory and material selection

- **Bug Fixes (COMPLETED):**
  - Fixed duplicate className error in Sales Pipeline lead cards
  - Fixed RFQ delete button by implementing cascading deletes (quotes → leads → items → RFQ)
  - Fixed Sales Pipeline edit button click propagation issues

README.md.content:
# Welcome to your Lovable project

## Project info

**URL**: https://lovable.dev/projects/09339987-bbf8-4fda-b4a0-7740032a929a

## How can I edit this code?

There are several ways of editing your application.

**Use Lovable**

Simply visit the [Lovable Project](https://lovable.dev/projects/09339987-bbf8-4fda-b4a0-7740032a929a) and start prompting.

Changes made via Lovable will be committed automatically to this repo.

**Use your preferred IDE**

If you want to work locally using your own IDE, you can clone this repo and push changes. Pushed changes will also be reflected in Lovable.

The only requirement is having Node.js & npm installed - [install with nvm](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm#installing-and-updating)

Follow these steps:

```sh
# Step 1: Clone the repository using the project's Git URL.
git clone <YOUR_GIT_URL>

# Step 2: Navigate to the project directory.
cd <YOUR_PROJECT_NAME>

# Step 3: Install the necessary dependencies.
npm i

# Step 4: Start the development server with auto-reloading and an instant preview.
npm run dev
```

**Edit a file directly in GitHub**

- Navigate to the desired file(s).
- Click the "Edit" button (pencil icon) at the top right of the file view.
- Make your changes and commit the changes.

**Use GitHub Codespaces**

- Navigate to the main page of your repository.
- Click on the "Code" button (green button) near the top right.
- Select the "Codespaces" tab.
- Click on "New codespace" to launch a new Codespace environment.
- Edit files directly within the Codespace and commit and push your changes once you're done.

## What technologies are used for this project?

This project is built with:

- Vite
- TypeScript
- React
- shadcn-ui
- Tailwind CSS

## How can I deploy this project?

Simply open [Lovable](https://lovable.dev/projects/09339987-bbf8-4fda-b4a0-7740032a929a) and click on Share -> Publish.

## Can I connect a custom domain to my Lovable project?

Yes, you can!

To connect a domain, navigate to Project > Settings > Domains and click Connect Domain.

Read more here: [Setting up a custom domain](https://docs.lovable.dev/features/custom-domain#custom-domain)
